8424C23B608C40C6BE85AA2AA0DC5E08.description: Research and respond to a diversity of choral music genres (e.g., sacred, secular, new/modern, Inuit throat singing, First Nations singing and drum groups).

CBC0017B1B57400EB12FC9AA2495E895.description: Examine how interpretation and experience of music is affected by oneâ€™s personal lens, context or worldview.

A7F09C6FB46F4E6BBA6D7359E8585719.description: Connect own experience to selected musical examples (e.g., What does the music mean to you? Does the music remind you of something?).

832189D9D0874A0CB5944107C5238244.description: Compare and contrast the same piece performed by two different groups (e.g., different tempo, musical phrasings).

30DFFD343A134BC8B175BAB91D0BCB81.description: Identify, through critical listening, different genres and styles of choral performances.

3E5FAC4C28CF44B3868719F85933013E.description: Conduct an inquiry into what is choral music (e.g., What is the definition of choral music or a choral ensemble given the diversity of cultures, eras and styles?).

087032B4509343CF9D62456EA65518B9.description: Respond to various choral selections (e.g., critique or a creative response)

8A7932FE12A44E0E940A438B85169043.description: Respond to a variety of live or recorded choral ensembles.

DA58F84858D84E2C81133D68A5957A76.description: Conduct an inquiry into choral music and expression (e.g., What makes the music good beyond the notes? How are we connecting ourselves to the piece? How do we convey that to our audience?).

85034F13079D4F768E2A102449D9C668.description: Examine the process of polishing a piece including how to refine a rehearsal (formative) or a performance (summative).

0F971358E554442796A18EF607037051.description: Reflect on own singing and set personal goals for improvement.

4DF940832DDD41AEAAF3740578D4CAF9.description: Reflect on ensemble singing and contribute to collective goal setting for improvement.

06777E463CE04961890EEB3043DB6240.description: Provide feedback on individual and ensemble singing (rehearsal and performance).

242A9E96EE6B47A18D18043701347214.description: Determine criteria collectively, with teacher support, for critiquing own ensemble rehearsals and performances.

DF774EA74EA74A27AABA3BCFB8BBE28B.description: Identify or set goals for improvement as individual singers and as an ensemble.

C20FDD7A39B6411DB08E052FC0DB3503.description: Critical/Responsive (CR) Goal: Students will respond to artistic expressions of Saskatchewan, Canadian and international artists using critical thinking, research, creativity and collaborative inquiry.

46C65EEFF0ED4CA693BB5AA31FAC172B.description: Examine legalities (e.g., copyrighting, trademarking, First Nations traditional laws, contracts) and ethics (e.g., illegal downloading, sampling, cultural protocols, compensation from streaming services) related to creating and producing choral music.

5898705C3C8640FDBC8634D533C6EC73.description: Discuss the difference between appropriation and incorporating ideas from other work.

D074E019239A44BA98FC91C3F35942AE.description: Examine scenarios involving copyright controversies in music.

63E659A2A4594A7CB00C48B22D1615F7.description: Describe factors that place some works in the public domain and cite some examples of these works along with reasons for their inclusion.

052AA518A206409AB15A8E6925B02828.description: Investigate legal and ethical issues, such as copyright and performance rights, related to choral music and performance.

B84CD64B48BE4478890D8AD5A0F27DD7.description: Seek opportunities to hear (live and recorded) and participate in choral music performances.

6E06FCCD786C4E3BBB24769D9ED96392.description: Discuss entrepreneurship and personal qualities required for pursuing a career in choral and other types of music.

DB48EA2C89774EBF98984F351F9B5931.description: Research career avenues and investigate opportunities (e.g., scholarships, entrance requirements, music schools) for continuing study at the post-secondary level.

3535337F24C84CBC934876B8FD9548B0.description: Demonstrate awareness of Saskatchewan and Canadian singers, composers, musicians and the music industry including local Indigenous musicians.

36B3FCE631B6437C9F361E41FC25D4D2.description: Research and discuss the benefits of participating in choral music (e.g., social, cognitive, physiological, psychological) as a lifelong pursuit.

BF0BC8FAF6B440E1AA86F6235042C82B.description: Identify pathways and benefits for continuing engagement in choral music.

E52032C9F91544308830F4240037837E.description: Discuss Indigenous ways of knowing and learning vocal music (e.g., songs passed down/shared/gifted, songs composed).

8564E5EDACA44546B7C6544F69471744.description: Explore the singing and traditional music of MÃ©tis people.

7145DE739F6C49BE8AF25CA3519DA482.description: Investigate vocal styles and song writing protocols and processes used in powwow social music.

9040358557414E77887692DD1DB63D04.description: Explore, with guidance of Indigenous resource people, differences in music, protocols and practices among Indigenous peoples in Saskatchewan and internationally.

D60E799C26AC47E3BD338D5AD23C6209.description: Examine the impact of historical contexts on Indigenous music (e.g., government ban on music and ceremonies, traditional versus competitive powwows, treaty education outcome SI11 - analyze how the unfulfilled aspects of treaties, with international Indigenous people, have resulted in inequities).

955307D4D47745C3BFEEA3B6D20FA6E6.description: Research and recognize there are different purposes for Indigenous ceremonial and social music.

23AD5C17C1E94C9BB7F8074A36706664.description: Research and recognize there are different purposes for Indigenous ceremonial and social music.

1FB2F1F5073C43A19A13C1FC8D8C9357.description: Engage with First Nations and MÃ©tis Elders or singers to differentiate characteristics and purposes of vocal music.

E68E5E868866469AB89AF1F614A8A357.description: Examine traditional vocal music of Indigenous peoples from Saskatchewan and around the world.

1124D07CE3DE4F1E98411C4D5F55DB4B.description: Investigate the role of, or connections between, music and social justice.

D52CDB271BB142F3BF0BCBD2F87A12C7.description: Explore underrepresented composers and discuss historical and contemporary inequities.

17B1B836927F44CCB8C792324171C51E.description: Discuss what is known about the composerâ€™s intent and how that intent influences the choirâ€™s interpretation and musical choices.

D8ACC691F93243ADAB6177EA20E1A7A5.description: Explore inquiry questions such as: What is the purpose or meaning of historically informed performance practices? What is a characteristic tone or sound of various cultural practices? How does knowing the composerâ€™s place and social environment of the time help to understand and interpret the work?

6548A68E20D6474C982412B1EC98789E.description: Recognize social and political influences on the composer of the choirsâ€™ repertoire.

5362EA2D14B343D9AC179EDF72EB0632.description: Investigate factors (e.g., place, time, societal events) that influenced the composer of the repertoire being studied.

CE63C6BE94624C7CA318E371A8D1F963.description: Cultural/Historical (CH) Goal: Students will investigate the content and aesthetics of the arts within cultural, historical and contemporary contexts and understand the connection between the arts and the human experience.

7A36484AA3D4497CB00B9CFAC5465D38.description: Incorporate stylistic features reflective of the socio-cultural contexts of the choral repertoire being studied.

2512B8C5DD934A0394944A5A5878C5B5.description: Sing (e.g., warm up, excerpt, repertoire, short folk song) in a minimum of two languages.

67D2BDE03F024A3C9EE5581D18E786E7.description: Demonstrate vocal characteristics and stylistic features that are typical in diverse music genres (e.g., spirituals, jazz, blues, opera).

ABDAEC8FE06E45B7A8252D9CB6743FC1.description: Demonstrate stylistic practices within various forms of vocal and choral music traditions.

22E11EEF96C74A19958941D53C19B76C.description: Reflect on individual and group compositions and arrangements, identifying strengths and challenges encountered.

E82DFFA968EA49FF8961B6C2C49618CA.description: Compose, arrange or improvise a short phrase (e.g., create a new melody or harmony).

B41C0EDB3D134C4496EE02323F6C4D14.description: Explore and examine composition and arranging techniques (e.g., What is the composer doing musically in relation to the text? What is a compositional hook?).

2A5FC28AF7A947DA9EFB001853DE3447.description: Experiment with stylistically appropriate group improvisation (e.g., with chords/harmonic background).

BA68083AC23C4988B1A28255C3897582.description: Embellish, ornament or improvise on a melody.

3D122A2B7B56489186509F98DE2F11C2.description: Take creative risks when creating and refining work.

32E5CE3898094D8DB0B46DE59D2097C8.description: Investigate ways that music elements (e.g., tempo, rhythm) can be used to express musical ideas.

207F0E731D8440E49580A271C81A0AE9.description: Investigate processes for improvising, arranging and composing.

9DE92FC9FA0A4C9EB765F5EC9C737F58.description: Interpret expressive terms and music symbols within the context of the repertoire (e.g., tempo, dynamics, form, style, articulation, graphic symbols).

8AC466D8EFF14961893AE34721C9162F.description: Demonstrate ability to learn music through aural transmission.

AF457D1293D342A4990B1A8F56554BB0.description: Sight sing a short passage (e.g., at a lower difficulty level than the repertoire studied).

8439C600AA634573A72D30CC96EEEC7A.description: Demonstrate increased ability to read, notate, understand and interpret written musical scores and various notation systems.

444C30CFA8F549348D7A744B1643089B.description: Demonstrate, with increased accuracy, the ability to respond to notation systems such as letter names, solfege, scale degrees and aural cues when singing in the context of the repertoire studied.

D4DE96C30BFF458B89A3A4973ED61C6A.description: Demonstrate ability to interpret, with increased accuracy, music using various visual (e.g., standard and/or non-standard notation, written musical scores, graphic score) and aural music systems.

BBA8D1E2E6F5427F806F451B06FC1487.description: Demonstrate ability to respond to the conductor

93A1E4DBD02E478D9B97F2F54AAA5E75.description: Incorporate movement in ensemble work (e.g., use movement to experience music concepts) recognizing how singing involves the whole body

B3E025C3219948FDB19B24A1C3E9F302.description: Identify musical functions of own part in a song (e.g., melody, harmony, bass line).

BD3B2F7FE14F4B56B17AAC22BBD8C7C2.description: Determine and apply processes (e.g., focusing on a specific part, experimenting with phrasing, running through from start to finish, working on sections, isolating variables, making group choices), with teacher guidance, for collective practise, rehearsal and performance.

6593669E0803415B9C684491FD0C7172.description: Demonstrate fluency and growth in vocal techniques and musicality when singing advanced vocal ensemble repertoire.

E90AB1A72E6E44EB9382A982B89BB391.description: Maintain accurate pitch when singing harmony.

D85ED72948594F66BE04BD6D1855C418.description: Explore interpretation abilities through versatility of voice (e.g., inflection, tone, emulating instrumental sounds).

A24016B1137644C0B2F81E0E749F9D2B.description: Demonstrate personal and interpersonal skills necessary for ensemble music making including: etiquette, rehearsal protocols and leadership.

3A64E949C7974C898B07FAF6C4A53632.description: Consistently demonstrate ensemble skills such as: adjusting dynamics, blending vowels, placing consonants, adjusting vibrato and maintaining own part.

17D5F090B81540C9860C4C127B53EDDA.description: Consistently demonstrate skills (e.g., intonation, pitch breathing, alignment) and practices necessary for ensemble singing.

DAB0140D02F041E0879471C1B237F8F0.description: Identify factors and apply techniques for maintaining vocal health.

ECC811D52EEB40729BB6B634C2FB5D0D.description: Demonstrate choral blend through vowel unity and modifying intonation.

6C5FFA252AB04C3A81CC07CB5F988FD3.description: Demonstrate and articulate the importance of proper posture and body alignment for singing.

2B2D3B3CE28348379CF51397A3013546.description: Demonstrate appropriate diction (e.g., clarity, appropriate vowel usage in the language, consonants, rolling Rs, releases, vowels) required of the language and repertoire demands

09405C7689B04064B4B2ADE4B87181CE.description: Examine principles of vocal anatomy and terminology (e.g., how does one support breathing, the role of articulators and resonators in enunciation).

611506346D094699A7D30AD7698B67E8.description: Apply, with guidance, a well supported tone.

DF986680A996464480D66DB1DE9097B1.description: Demonstrate different vocal registration (e.g., head voice, chest voice, falsetto, speaking voice).

2946624DD10E457899DA820C829941EC.description: Experiment with own range (e.g., warm ups) and practise healthy ways to expand own range.

61788562AD664F338006B860698EAB1F.description: Practise vocal warm ups and identify the purpose of specific warm ups.

2632AF6275CE40139EB179069092BABE.description: Hear and match pitch; discern accuracy of notes.

D8F75A79083A4BC28A37D53C219DCAC8.description: Assess and demonstrate characteristics of quality singing based on collaboratively developed criteria and considering cultural contexts.

A3D53A31EDCB4C12BD97173C1FDCC95D.description: Sing with breath support (e.g., practise appropriate breathing technique and recognize how it helps support sound production and vocal health).

18202C52D08845798C51C606BA6D71E9.description: Consistently demonstrate fundamentals of vocal technique.

5C6C879A797A4A95ADC47A3AFED075B9.description: Creative/Productive (CP) Goal: Students will inquire, create and communicate through dance, drama, music and visual art.
